byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Hesston, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Julie Turkewitz from Denver. Reporting was contributed by Katie Rogers from New York; Jack Healy from Denver; Lizette Alvarez from Miami Gardens, Fla.; Nick Madigan from Homestead, Fla.; Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Jacksonville, Fla.; and Frances Robles from Miami.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and JULIE TURKEWITZ

abstract: Starkly contrasting descriptions of Cedric Ford have emerged as police try to determine why he went on shooting spree at Excel Industries plant in Hesston, Kan, leaving three dead and 14 injured; co-workers describe Ford as quiet and affable, whereas former girlfriend has described him as depressed alcoholic in need of psychological help.
lead_paragraph: As the authorities piece together what led Cedric Larry Ford to fatally shoot three colleagues and injure 14 more, the latest in a string of mass shootings, contradictory pictures of him have emerged.

headline.main: In Kansas, Pop-Pop-Pop, Then Terror: ‘We Got to Go’
headline.print_headline: Kansas Gunman Was Warned by Court Just Before Attack

snippet: As the authorities piece together what led Cedric Larry Ford to fatally shoot three colleagues and injure 14 more, the latest in a string of mass shootings, contradictory pictures of him have emerged.
